meanings.definition: A person or thing that is remarkable or excellent.
meanings.sent1: The new superhero movie was a real whizzer!
meanings.sent2: The cake she baked was a real whizzer at the bake sale.
meanings.sent3: Everyone agreed that the talking parrot was the real whizzer of the party.
meanings.sent4: Her idea to use recycled materials for the project was a whizzer of an innovation.
meanings.sent5: The magician's final trick was a whizzer that left the audience in awe.

meanings.sent1: The top spun with a whizzer that mesmerized the children.
meanings.sent2: The tornado's whizzer was so powerful, it uprooted trees.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's graceful twirls created a whizzer of colors on stage.
meanings.sent4: The carousel's constant whizzer made everyone feel dizzy with joy.
meanings.sent5: The whirlpool's strong whizzer sucked everything towards its center.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that moves quickly or with great skill.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was a real whizzer when it came to hunting.
meanings.sent2: The delivery boy on his bike was a whizzer at getting orders delivered on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was a little whizzer, darting around the park collecting nuts.
meanings.sent4: The basketball player was a whizzer on the court, scoring points effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The race car driver was known as a whizzer for his lightning-fast speeds.
